comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Daughter of New York Supreme Court justice Edward Everett McCall (1863-1924) and his wife, the former Ella F. Gaynor.  In 1913, Edward Everett McCall was appointed by the governor to the Public Service Commission.  in 1914, Edward Everett McCall was running for mayor of New York City, with Tammany Hall backing.  In 1915 Constance was a maid of honor at her sister Ella's wedding to William R. Maloney.  In 1924, she's still listed as Miss Constance McCall in obituaries following her father's passing.

comment.author: 22390815@N05
comment._content: I almost missed the 2 dogs looking at her and her hat!
